fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24273].
  {panel}

When using browser zoomed in (cmd -/+ & ctrl -/+) zoom level reaches a point where the save and cancel buttons for lightbox windows (ie insert link, add attachment to pages etc) fall out of screen edges and users can no longer interact with those buttons without changing the zoom level or some other window property (size/resolution/zoom level).

Request is for unnecessary whitespace to be removed from lightbox so that users can use Confluence without adjusting zoom level to access lightbox buttons.

Steps to reproduce:
# Open a page for editing
# Click Insert Link button
# Zoom in using cmd + / ctrl + until insert / cancel buttons a below bottom visible edge of lightbox.
fields.summary: Remove unnecessary whitespace from lightbox so users zoomed in can access buttons

fields.description:
In Chrome v16 Stable, when attempting to download an mp4 file, the "Save As" option never appears when the link is clicked. 

This issue can be reproduced in Google Chrome v16 Stable only. In 17 dev, the issue appears to go away.

To workaround the issue, the user would need to right-click and select Save As on any attachment they wish to download using Chrome.
fields.summary: Chrome does not attempt to download MP4 files.

fields.description:
The entries in a tasklist are not displayed if a table of contents macro is used.

I was able to reproduce this at the Atlassian Confluence sandbox: http://sandbox.onconfluence.com/display/2/Tasklist-Contents+Test

To reproduce:

* Create a new page
* Create a tasklist
* Save
* Add a task: "My Task"
* Edit
* Create a TOC at the top
* Save
* View the page: "My Task" is gone

If you edit the page again you can still see the task data, it just doesn't show up when you view the page.

I first noticed this with my standalone installation of Confluence 4.0, but it seems to affect 4.0.4 in the Sandbox.

I also posted this at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23906 in November from directly within Atlassian jira, but wasn't sure if going through the bug report link from my Confluence installation made a difference.
fields.summary: Table of contents makes tasklist blank

fields.description:

* Typing '{' does not bring up macros that can be browsed.
* Typing '[' does not bring up a list of suggested pages and insert a link.

There are more problems similar to this.

I've tried to uncheck the Disable Autocomplete and Disable Autoformatting options under Settings->Editor, but they are checked and I can't uncheck them. See attached screen shot.
fields.summary: Autocomplete and autoformatting are disabled and can't be re-enabled

fields.description:
When creating a user macro, there is no support for specifying use of the default parameter -- <ac:default-parameter> in storage format.

When defining the macro parameters, parsing of parameters requires that the macro parameter have a name, otherwise the parameter is ignored (with the log warning of "Skipping undefined parameter for macro <macroName>"). However, the default parameter has no name.

This is of particular concern to users upgrading from 3.5 to 4.x, where their user macros will be migrated to use <ac:default-parameter>, yet it cannot be referenced as a legitimate user macro parameter by the macro browser.
fields.summary: User Macros cannot make use of the default parameter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24252].
  {panel}

We've managed to make Dashboard layout look like page in Documentation Theme. Please find a screenshot in attachment. 

But some efforts needed.

First, insert into /decorators/global.wmd  code
{code}
<content tag="tree">
some users macro....
</content>
{code}

This action adds Splitbar to dashboard. But, when we are on Dashboard, Space is undefined. That is why error raising when rendering left menu on Dashboard.

To fix this, open doctheme.jar/doctheme/decorators/main.wmd
Find the following code fragment
{code}
#if ($!docThemeHelper.getThemeHeader($spaceKey)!="")
    $!sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.theme-header")
#end
{code}

and replace it with:
{code}
#if ($spaceKey)
    #if ($!docThemeHelper.getThemeHeader($spaceKey)!="")
        $!sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.theme-header")
    #end
#end
{code}


So, we need to make these changes every time when DocTheme updates. It will be nice to fix it and relax.

By the way, where does doctheme jar file lives after plugin installation? Usually it appears inside atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip in confluence-4.0/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/setup. But since  two of three recent versions, I could not find it there.
fields.summary: Applying Documentation Theme to Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24251].
  {panel}

There will be quite useful to add two parameters that might be changed through Administration Console:
1. Render Labels
2. Render Children

We are using Confluence with Documentation Theme as Company Intranet Portal. This theme suites us well, but we do not use Label as well as Children on each display.

Every time we install Doctheme update, we have to modify
doctheme-x.x.x.jar/doctheme/decorators/page.vmd

Find the following code fragment:
  
#parse ("/labels/labels-dialog.vm")
#parse ("/labels/labels-editor.vm")
#renderChildren()

and replace it with:
 
##parse ("/labels/labels-dialog.vm")
##parse ("/labels/labels-editor.vm")
##renderChildren()

(just to comment these strings). It's uncomfortable a bit)

Is there any way to store these settings separately, e.g. in properties file or database? Settings should keep their values when Doctheme updates.
fields.summary: Configuration of Documentation Theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24247].
  {panel}

Can we add a feature that would allow us to add a Not or ! condition to the query? Right now I can do something like this:

1. Show all content where label = first OR label = second OR label = third
2. Show all content where label = first AND label = second AND label = third

What I would like to do is something like this:

1. Show all content where (label = first AND label = second AND label = third) AND Not label = forth

Basically that would like pages with all of those labels but not pages that include the final label. The use case for this is that we have built a nice page that shows all of our projects tagged with different labels that describe information about those projects such as priority. What I would like is when a label 'archive' is added to a page it will then automatically not show up on the project page. The old labels need to stay on the page for historical purposes.

Note that this was submitted to support via this link: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-73759
fields.summary: Label by Content Improvement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24245].
  {panel}

{panel}
*Note:* the workaround is to merge dangling cells into the left cell.
{panel}

Missing the ability to delete table cells, if we had this we could create "pyramid tables" as we could before using the rich text editor.

E.g.

| 1 |
| 2 | 3 |
| 4 | 5 | 6 |

(used for ½ matrixes)

Updating such a table also needs some thought because using the "insert markup" can actually create such a table, but we can't extend it to:

| 1 |
| 2 | 3 |
| 4 | 5 | 6 |
| 7 | 8 | 9 | 0 |

Instead we have to create it from buttom.

Copy pasting table rows through "Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V", so maybe just as well as being able to delete cells, we should be able to "Split" a single cell in a single row or something, I am really now sure how the best way would be, before we just added the row with an extra cell at the end...

Doing the same procedure but to stylised text ie. headings, monospace, quotes, etc forces each line despite selecting "In Line".

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24th July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
We've discovered that this issue has been duplicated by the issue at CONFSERVER-28739 - copy and pasting web images will not attach the image to the page. While this is a confirmed bug in Confluence, please watch that issue for further updates, and more detailed workarounds.
{panel}

That is, you can successfully paste and save an image in an editor window using Safari as long as you did not copy the image from a Safari window.

However, if you copy the image from a Safari window and paste it into an editor window using Safari then you will not be able to paste the image

[video|http://screencast.com/t/cyVWIv5kK]

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Find an image using google images
# Right click copy
# Open an editor window using Safari
# Right click paste

The image will not be pasted

Reproduced on CAC
fields.summary: Unable to copy and paste images from a Safari window

fields.description:
On large pages, long-running script warnings are popping up in IE8 on page load, save and some other operations.

A trace of the page load reveals the major slowdown occurs in an {{onGetContent}} event from the cursor target plugin.

Attached is a sample page with sufficient amounts of content to trigger the long-running script warning in IE8.

The performance of this plugin needs to be improved such that the long-running script warning does not get triggered in the following situations:

* On loading the editor
* Refreshing the page
* Cancelling editing of the page
* Saving the page

In addition, it may be possible that adding new table rows to the bottom of a large table is also causing these warnings to appear.
fields.summary: Cursor Target plugin too slow to run in IE8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24208].
  {panel}

For example: 

|a|b|c|d|
|a|z|z|d|
|a|z|z|d|
|a|b|c|d|

Allow the ability to select the 2x2 square in the centre containing only Z's. 

Right now, if you drag using your mouse, Confluence gives the impression that it is only selecting these 4 cells. On releasing of the mouse button, you get a resulting selection that encompasses:

| |z|z|d|
|a|z|z| |
 
Fix this, to allow copying pasting of subsets as well as 1xN subsets (which is effectively a column)

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24202].

Currently, each page has a tiny link, but if we want to link somebody to a particular comment, we have to append the comment fragment to the end of the tiny link.

It'd be nice if we could link directly to a comment with a tiny link.

Original discussion on #gradlassian:

{noformat}
12:51:19 PM peggy: is there a way to get a shorturl to a comment on confluence?
12:55:42 PM puxlit: doesn't [Page#comment-12345] work?

12:56:19 PM peggy: instead of the entire URL
12:56:24 PM puxlit: ah
12:56:51 PM peggy: but can't seem to find a similar tinylink feature for specifying a comment
12:57:16 PM puxlit: https://extranet.atlassian.com/x/cQ3Qbw#comment-1876558365 works, but I know what you mean
12:57:23 PM puxlit: *shrugs*
12:57:27 PM puxlit: perhaps it's not implemented
12:57:29 PM puxlit: bit.ly!

1:00:29 PM peggy: will do for now*

1:01:04 PM puxlit: I guess we should raise a feature request for this
{noformat}

Hello,
 


I would like to access confluence through / hidden behind my webserver preferable even ssl protected.
 
- I had that working with the previeus confluence version by using apache proxy
 


First step is of course to change the base url in confluence general configuration. However after changing server base url from http://localhost:8090 to e.g. http://<mydomain>:8090/confluence I obeserved two problems:
 
1) the base url did not change (e.g. site still refering to http://<mydomain > not http://<mydomain>/confluence
 
2) the plugin administration page is telling me it can not access the plugin site (which it can as soon as I switch back to the original base url)
 

Both seems not OK to me

At this moment:
- I can not acces confluence from within my website 
(I could access confluence 403 via http proxy and ssl)
- since the confluence site should not be accessable via "8090" but via a normal port 80/443 webbrouwser I regard this is sevire


Sincerely,
 


Louis

fields.description:
A minor niggle, but the Autoconvert functionality does not work for URLs beginning maps.google.co.uk (and [any other regional Google domains|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Google_domains]) because the Widget Connector doesn't support them.

The editor recognises the URLs as ones that it can convert and they display as a widget connector in the editor, but when you preview or save the page you get the broken Widget image as shown in the attached screenshot (first Widget is using google.com, second Widget is using google.co.uk).

To reproduce:

1. Visit maps.google.co.uk
2. Search for Cardiff
3. Click the Link icon to reveal the embed URL
4. Paste the following in to the Confluence editor:
http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?q=Cardiff&hl=en&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=37.598824,71.279297&vpsrc=0&hnear=Cardiff,+United+Kingdom&t=m&z=12
5. Editor recognises it as an Autoconvert URL
6. Save or Preview the page to see the broken Widget

Changing the URL to:
http://maps.google.com/maps?q=Cardiff&hl=en&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=37.598824,71.279297&vpsrc=0&hnear=Cardiff,+United+Kingdom&t=m&z=12
fixes the problem.

As mentioned, a minor niggle, but as the editor recognises maps.google.co.uk as an Autoconvert URL I'm assuming that it's supposed to render the map correctly?
fields.summary: Widget Connector does not work for Google Maps of regional domains

fields.description:
When Preformatting text all formatting capabilities disappear.
 - This includes the "clear formatting" which is kind of counter intuitive.
 - The placement of "clear formatting" is also counter intuitive in general.
 - Preformatting Bullets the bullets remains, but you are not able to Apply bullets or remove them from preformatted text, this seems like a conflicting behavior, either remove the bullets or allow that sort of indentation and formatting. (This might be fixed in a later version)

In general anything to do with the "Preformatted" style is currently just very strange, very inconsistent.
fields.summary: Preformatted disables all formatting menus "Clear Formatting"

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When receiving daily notification e-mails from Confluence 4.1, if the subject of the e-mail contains umlauts, it will not be rendered correctly

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Enable 'Subscribe to daily updates'
# Ensure that there have been changes in the instance, and then either wait for the daily e-mail to be sent, or force it to run (scheduled jobs)
# Check the subject of the e-mail to see if it is rendered correctly

h3. Findings

* This is a screenshot of how the e-mail looks like :
!email notification.png|thumbnail!
* I have tested receiving this mail using both gmail and ymail, and both of them are affected
fields.summary: Daily e-mail notifications in 4.1 doesn't show umlauts correctly

fields.description: When trying to add a page using a template, the page which displays the available templates does not render correctly, and am unable to select the appropriate template page.
fields.summary: Add using Template page doesn't render correctly in IE 8
Remove Google Gears references

fields.summary: Attempting to indent moves point above after deleting bullet point

fields.description:
To reproduce:
* Insert a multimedia macro onto a page
* select the multimedia macro and center align it within the page using the alignment buttons in editor toolbar
* in edit mode the macro will look center aligned.
* save the page and view it

Expected result - the multimedia macro output is center aligned
Actual result - the multimedia macro output is left-aligned (default)
fields.summary: Cannot center align multimedia macro

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create a list with one parent item and three child items
{noformat}
# Parent 1
** Child 1
** Child 2
** Child 3
{noformat}
# Delete "Child 2"
{noformat}
# Parent 1
** Child 1
** 
** Child 3
{noformat}

The empty list item will be missed on save or preview like this
{noformat}
# Parent 1
** Child 1
** Child 3
{noformat}

[video|http://screencast.com/t/UavmeIrvFD]

Repro on CAC using
IE9
FF8
Chrome
fields.summary: Empty list item cannot be previewed or saved
